bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Ralph Cooper Hutchison, November 3, 1939

div1.p: Hench volunteers to speak on the story of Kissinger and Moran at the Washington and Jefferson College Founders' Day program. He plans to meet Moran in Cuba. He offers a monetary contribution for Washington and Jefferson College.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Ralph Cooper Hutchison, November 3, 1939
div1.opener:
leave
on desk.
November 3, 1939
My dear Hutch:
div1.p:
I was delighted to receive your letter, and I should like indeed
to join you in your California jaunt.

I am awfully glad you are planning to have the Medical Founders'
Day, and I am already beginning to make a little list for my own pondering as to who
might be a couple of good medical speakers. Last night I put one man on my list,
and this morning in the paper, I noticed he had received the Nobel Prize. He is a
German but I understand he speaks perfect English. That shows how good a picker I
am.

I am in constant touch with Kissinger and Moran. Indeed, I expect
to visit Moran in Havana in March, hopping over from Florida. I shall, of course, be
glad to do whatever I can in a very small way, and if you think, after the thing all
works out, that you still want a little talk by me on the story of Kissinger and Moran,
I shall be glad to give it. As a matter of fact, I already have a number of lantern
slides on the subject, and in Havana will take pictures of scenes of the investigative
work as they now look; but between now and then, you may make many changes in plans,
which may exclude me. If so, you don't have to worry about it. Just write and tell
me about it.

I have long wanted to make a little contribution for your work,
and it isn't for lack of interest in you or in W. and J that I haven't done it. I
have simply had so many prior calls. As it is, my contributions for this and last
year exceeded what the income tax allows me, so you see I haven't shirked. Please put
me down for one hundred dollars for you to use in whatever way you wish, although if
it is to be for the Lazear Building, that would please me. I wish to God it were
ten or one hundred times that much, but I just sent Lafayett a hundred, and the local
boy scouts have nicked me this year very well. What with these contributions, and a
small one to Alborz College, I may get on relief yet! I am dictating this down town, as
I am leaving on the train very shortly. Hence, a check will be sent to you after I
return.

I am enroute to Chicago and New York. The Howdie Grays and the
Henches are motoring from Chicago to New York, leaving Chicago via Akron, Ohio where
we are visiting the Seiberlings from Sunday until Tuesday, then on to New York, arriving
at the Hotel Roosevelt on Wednesday Nov.8. I will be in New York until Saturday morning. Do
you expect to be in the neighborhood? Then the Grays and Henches expect to go to the
Princeton game. By the way, if there is any chance of your getting near there, please
let me know, as I may not be able to go to the game, and who knows, I may hand you my
ticket and my wife!
div1.closer: Very sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
